Irregular Functional Data representation¶

Module for IrregularFunctionalData classes.

This module is used define irregular functional data.

class FDApy.irregular_functional.IrregularFunctionalData(argvals, values, standardize=True)¶

An object for defining Irregular Functional Data.

Parameters

  • argvals (list of numpy.ndarray) – A list of numeric vectors (tuples) giving the sampling points for each realization of the process.

  • values (list of numpy.array) – A list of numeric arrays, representing the values of each realization of the process on the corresponding observation points.

  • standardize (boolean, default = True) – Do we standardize the argvals to be in [0, 1].

Notes

Currently, only one dimensional irregular functional data have been implemented.

The standardization of the Irregular Functional Data is useful only if all are defined on different domains and we have the complete trajectories. And it may not be useful if all the functional data are defined on the same domain and we do not record some the signal for some times.

property argvals¶

Getter argvals.

property argvals_stand¶

Getter argvals_stand.

concat(*args)¶

Concatenate functional data.

Parameters

args (list of IrregularFunctionalData) –

Returns

  • The concatenation of the IrregularFunctionalData as a unique

  • IrregularFunctionalData object.

dimension()¶

Common dimension of the observations of the object.

Returns

Return type

Number of dimension of the observations of the object (int)

Note

Currently, this function must always return 1 as the multi-dimensional irregular functional data is not yet implemented.

nObs()¶

Number of observations of the object.

Returns

n – Number of observations of the object.

Return type

int

nObsPoint()¶

Number of sampling points of the objects.

Returns

n – List of the same length of self.nObs() where the i-th entry correspond to the number of sampling points of the i-th observed function.

Return type

list of int

rangeObs()¶

Range of the observations of the objects.

Returns

min(values_), max(values_) – Tuple containing the minimum and maximum number of all the observations for an object.

Return type

tuple

rangeObsPoint()¶

Range of sampling points of the objects.

Returns

min(argvals_), max(argvals_) – Tuple containing the minimum and maximum number of all the sampling points for an object.

Return type

tuple
